ccre.cluck

Class CluckSubscriber

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.cluck.CluckSubscriber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CluckLink

    public abstract class CluckSubscriber
extends java.lang.Object
implements CluckLink
    A helper class for objects shared on a CluckNode, by providing lots of basic implementation for links.

    • Method Detail

      • transmit

        public final boolean transmit(java.lang.String dest,
               java.lang.String source,
               byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: CluckLink
        Send a Cluck message over this link. Dest and source are forward-slash-separated paths. The destination is relative to the node at the other end of the link - the name of this link has already been stripped off. The source is relative to the previous node - it should get the name of this link on the other end added to it so that messages can be sent in response.
        Specified by:
        transmit in interface CluckLink
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination path.
        source - The source path.
        data - The data packet.
        Returns:
        true if more messages should be delivered, false if this should be detached from the CluckNode.

      • attach

        public final void attach(CluckNode node,
          java.lang.String name)
        Attach this subscriber to the specified name on the specified node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to attach to.
        name - The name to attach with.

      • handleOther

        protected void handleOther(java.lang.String dest,
               java.lang.String source,
               byte[] data)
        Should be overridden to handle a message sent to something other than this node or the broadcast address.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination path.
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data.

      • requireRMT

        protected boolean requireRMT(java.lang.String source,
                 byte[] data,
                 byte rmt)
        A handler for a common operation - ensure the message is not null, reply to the message if it's a PING message, ensure that the remote type of the message is correct, and then return true if all checks succeed.
        Parameters:
        source - The source address.
        data - The message contents.
        rmt - The remote type of this subscriber.
        Returns:
        If this message should be handled as the given remote type.

      • defaultBroadcastHandle

        protected void defaultBroadcastHandle(java.lang.String source,
                          byte[] data,
                          byte rmt)
        Default handler for a broadcasted message - reply to it if it's a PING message, otherwise ignore it
        Parameters:
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data.
        rmt - The remote type of this subscriber.

      • receive

        protected abstract void receive(java.lang.String source,
           byte[] data)
        Implement to handle messages sent to this subscriber. Usually this is wrapped in a conditional of requireRMT.
        Parameters:
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data.

      • receiveBroadcast

        protected abstract void receiveBroadcast(java.lang.String source,
                    byte[] data)
        Implement to handle messages broadcasted to this subscriber. Usually this is implemented using defaultBroadcastHandle.
        Parameters:
        source - The source path.
        data - The message data.
